com.soa.delegate.jaxws
Class JAXWSBaseFacade<INTF>

java.lang.Object
  com.soa.delegate.client.AbstractBaseFacade<INTF>
      com.soa.delegate.jaxws.JAXWSBaseFacade<INTF>

public abstract class JAXWSBaseFacade<INTF>
extends com.soa.delegate.client.AbstractBaseFacade<INTF>

This is the base class for all JAX-WS 2.x Web Service client facade implementations that are going to use the SOA Client Delegate outside the JSR109 framework or other mechanism that allows declarative specification of client-side message handlers.

There are goals met in this implementation:

  1. Provide standardized mechanism to locate and instantiate the concrete implementation of the given Service Interface. The "stub" that is created will be used by the sub-class to invoke web service methods.
  2. Make sure that the appropriate SOA Client Delegate Message Handler is configured for use for all services. Logic will dynamically determine whether the facade is running inside the J2EE Web or Bean container, inside a J2EE Application Client Container, or as a Java main() batch program.
  3. Establish a framework that allows consumer applications to add their own message handler processing for the web service calls.

Since:
6.0

Method Detail

getService

public INTF getService(java.lang.Object[] args)
                throws DelegateException
Return the concrete implementation of the Service Interface. This method dynamically locates a getXxxxPort() method with a matching signature and invoke it on a Service Locator object to create the implementation class associated with the WSDL binding. Objects obtained with this method should not be multi-threaded. It is usually recommended that these objects only live for the duration of the business transaction.

Specified by:
getService in class com.soa.delegate.client.AbstractBaseFacade<INTF>
Parameters:
args - is an array of objects (Object[]) to be passed to the getXxxPort() method. Depending on the implementation, these arguments might be a target URL string or a user name and password.
Returns:
Object generated by a concrete implementation class in a manner appropriate for the associated Web Service stack.
Throws:
DelegateException - when serious errors occur in either the configuration of this facade or in creating the Service Interface implementation object.
